page.title: 02FARMING. WILDEN AREA.
page.content: Wilden has always been an agricultural parish. Almost all the land in the Block has been cleared and is farmed.Some 30 acres of remnant woodland remain, only little less than in 1817 when the parish was enclosed. Much of the land slopes down to South Brook. {Arable and in particular cereal farming predominates, with about 80% of the land given over to crops and fallow.Wheat and barley are the main crops. There are smaller acreages of potatoes, rape,and brussel sprouts.There is only one main dairy holding, and one mixed. A sizeable proportion of those in employment work on the land, namely some 40 farmers, and members of their families, hired workers, and a variable number of seasonal or casual workers.
